publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7909 James Kelly: Congratulations to Rutherglen West and Wardlawhill Parish Church—That the Parliament congratulates Rutherglen West and Wardlawhill Parish Church on its 175th anniversary; notes that the church has a history stretching back to January 1836 and celebrated this with a special service led by the Rev Dr Angus Kerr, Clerk to the Presbytery of Glasgow, the cutting of an anniversary cake and a time of fellowship over lunch, and notes that, in addition to affiliated activities, the church hosts a wide range of activities in adjoining halls used by a variety of community organisations and groups.

S3M-7909 James Kelly: Congratulations to Rutherglen West and Wardlawhill Parish Church—That the Parliament congratulates Rutherglen West and Wardlawhill Parish Church on its 175th anniversary; notes that the church has a history stretching back to January 1836 and celebrated this with a special service led by the Rev Dr Angus Kerr, Clerk to the Presbytery of Glasgow, the cutting of an anniversary cake and a time of fellowship over lunch, and notes that, in addition to affiliated activities, the church hosts a wide range of activities in adjoining halls used by a variety of community organisations and groups.

S3M-7909 Congratulations to Rutherglen West and Wardlawhill Parish Church (lodged on 7 February 2011) Jackie Baillie*, Sarah Boyack*, Pauline McNeill*, Helen Eadie*, Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Bill Aitken*, Bob Doris*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-7909 Congratulations to Rutherglen West and Wardlawhill Parish Church (lodged on 7 February 2011) Gil Paterson*, Hugh Henry*
